lines.text: Listen, why don't you ever arrest some white drivers?
I do.
You do? Well, where are they? I don't see any. Look at all these niggers in here. Look around here. There's enough niggers in here to make a Tarzan movie.
Was the suspect colored?
Yeah, white.
You're a dirty old man ya know that?
And I'm gonna be one 'till I'm a dead old man.
Who is it?
It's Esther!
Esther who?
You know Esther who! Open this door fool!
I can't open the door!
Why not?
You too ugly!
Woodrow and I are going to have a baby.
Well somebody better call the zoo.
My body was blessed by Mother Nature, honey.
And as you got older, it was cursed by Father Time.
Fred Sanford, the wrath of God will strike you down.
And this Louisville slugger will knock you out.

We could have a little pork and beans now and a little zucchini later. Or a little zucchini now and a little pork and beans later. Or if you like the pork and beans, you can have them and I'll take the zucchini or I can take the pork and beans and you the zucchini so what will it be? Zucchini or pork and beans?
The oven don't work.
Oh, in that case, we'll have some cold pork and beans now or...
Would you stop that?
Ain't you got some work to do, Oleo?
The name is Julio, Mr. Stanford.
It's "Sanford", Julio.
Okay, then.
Why don't you clean your yard up? Go take a bath. Go milk your goat.
I did all that this morning, man.
Well, why don't you go back to Puerto Rico?
Mr. Sanford, I told you. I come from New York City. And I can live in any 50 states that I want.
Well, how about Alaska? That's a state.
You know what they say, the truth will set you free.
Your uncle Edgar told the truth, and the judge gave him six months.
For a dummy, you make a lot of sense.
Moses spread his arms out and the Red Sea divided.
So we're gonna do like Moses?
No, we're gonna do like the Red Sea and split.
Who is it?
It's the phone company. They say that if we don't pay the bill, they're gonna cut it off.

Gimmie that. Hello? Yes, this is Fred Sanford. Yeah, the phone is listed in my name. Say listen, what makes you folks think you can call me and cut somebody's phone off just because they're a little behind in their bill? Listen, I need my phone for my place of business. That's right, I wish one of you would come over here and try to cut my phone off. I'd put my foot in your - Hello?
Don't be ridiculous, Pop, you can't fight a traffic ticket.

I'm not being ridiclous. You are. Now look, you get a ticket by a white cop in a blue uniform in a black neighborhood, making you so mad you see red. And you ain't gonna fight it 'cause you too yellow. Now what are you? A man or a box of crayons?
The characters on that show are a lot like you. There's the grouchy father, the dumb son, the ugly sister in-law and the stupid, bungling friend
[looks at Grady]

[sarcastically]
Your too hard on yourself Bubba.
She can't stay here, because there isn't any room.
That's what they told the baby Jesus but they found him a place.
Okay, I'll build you a little manger out in the back yard and get you some sheep to sleep with.
Listen, Son, I kow everything that's going on here and that's your business.
I was hoping you'd understand...
If you wanna be down here with that girl, that's your business. I mean, if you wanna be hugging and kissing all night, that's your business.
I appreciate it...
But when she smacks your face and the police come here and arrest me for harboring a sex maniac, then that's MY business. So you get her the hell out of here.
What's the matter with you, man?
Didn't you read the paper?
No. What happened?
Lucy stole Linus' blanket and hid it in Snoopy's dog house.
00 news.
Pop, since you was 10, you smoked a cigarette 41 miles long.
That's real super king sized ain't it?
41 miles. That's like you smoked a cigarette from here to Disneyland.
Tell him in Puerto Rican - "Goat-o, get out of el house-o."
Who you calling ugly, sucker?
I'm calling you ugly, I could push your face in some dough and make gorilla cookies.
On behalf of Elizabeth, would you care for something to eat?
Oh I wouldn't mind a little snack.
Son, go in the kitchen and fix your Aunt Esther a fish-head sandwich!
They're predicting a massive earthquake on November 6.
November 6? That's only five days away!
Don't worry about a thing, Pop, it's not possible.
Oh I beg to differ with you, Lamont. Today is November 1, and it's extremely possible that November 6 is only five days away.
Fred Sanford why is it every time I come over to your house you call me ugly?
Because I'm not the type to lie.
This is a pea coat.
Did you know that when you bought it?
Where are you going?

[drunk]
St. Louis. On the banks of the Misississippi. M-I-S... I-S-S... M-O-U-S-E.
I'll do it, but on one condition.
And that is?
I want a white dentist.
What did you say?
You heard me, I want a white dentist.
Well what makes you think you're going to get a black dentist?
You said it was a free clinic, didn't you? Where you think you're gonna find a black dentist? In Beverly Hills?
Wasn't you the guy who told me once that you didn't want nothing white but milk?

Well my tooth wasn't hurting then. I want the best available dentist for my tooth. Now just by coincidence, the best dentist schools are of the white people, by the white people, and for the white people. Now don't it seem likely that the best dentist would be white? White dentist, please?
Now she's got TB.
What?
Terrific Body.
Listen, Esther. In the first place, you can't enter that contest because your not eligible. See one of the things you have to be is a part of a certain race.
What race?
Human!
Goodbye, dear
Oh, you called me dear.
Why shouldn't I call you DEER? You look like Bambi's father!
She's gonna be competing with her own peers.
Her Peers?
Yes.
You mean Godzilla is in the contest?
What's wrong with my posture?
It's full of prune pits!

[Officer Hopkins helps Grady inside]
What's the matter, Grady?
It's really nothing much to be concerned about, Mr. Sanford. He's merely experiencing a mild gastrointestinal imbalance precipitated by acute anti-gravitational pull in the lower abdominal cavity.
I gotta throw up!
Don't you go in my room by mistake, cause if I pull back them covers and see you I might have a stroke and die.
Fred Sanford, you have been sinning and transgressing all your life. If the Lord wanted to strike you down, he'll find ya. Even if you were going to Las Vegas.
Buenos Dias, Mr. Sanford.
And beans and disease to you, too.

[to Lamont about his date]
She's a lush and you a dummy. My granbaby will be a lummy

[Coughs violently]
Smokin' less but enjoying it more.
[Lamont enters room]
Hey Lamont you bring me cigarettes?
What?
Cigarettes. Smokes. Did you get them?
Did you hear yourself just now?
Yeah I asked if you brung me cigarettes.
No I mean did you hear yourself coughing? I heard you a block away, it sounded like they was tearing up the streets.
[clutching his chest dramatically]
Oh, this is the biggest one I ever had. You hear that Elizabeth? I'm coming to join you honey.
I still want to sow some wild oats.
At your age, you don't have no wild oats, you got shredded wheat.
Did you listen to your father?
Every time he raised that strap, he had my complete attention.
All you got to do is enlist Esther in the Navy. And that way, you can have her face buried at sea!
For $500 dollars, I can turn Yewell Gibbons into a meatloaf freak!
Polly-Esther - that's you. Half woman, half parrot!
These two Russian seismologists said they've discovered a new fault.
Well what was wrong with the old one?
Looky here. This is the bedroom.
[Slams door]
Second bedroom.
[Slams door]
Sun room.
[Slams door]
Bathroom.
HEY!
Excuse me.
[Slams door]
I cant believe it, you with a mop in your hand? Its about time you faced up to this mess.
Speaking of facing up to this mess, who messed up this face.
Fred told me to keep you out of this garden.
Oh he did huh?
Yea, Fred said just because he planted a garden of Eden, there was no reason to let the serpent in.
The next time you see that creep Woodrow, you tell him his behind is grass... and I am the lawnmower.
[Fred comes home drunk]
Fred Sanford, you just a messy fool.
And you just a sessy pool.
Today is my lucky day.
Why? Did you look at yourself in the mirror and it didn't break?
Oh, you two live together?
If you want to call it that.
[repeated line]
How would you like one across yo lip?
Address?
9114 South Central.
Oh, that's in Watts?
It sure ain't Beverly Hills.

[Lamont complains that Fred isn't a good businessman]
A six-year-old does better business than you!

Well, pretty soon you won't have to deal with me any more, I'll be joinin' your mother, and you can get a six-year-old to replace me, and it won't be Sanford and Son anymore, it'll be Big Dummy and Little Dummy Inc!

[to Aunt Esther]
I warn you, woman, vengeance is among me! And ugly is among you.
I think this guy was a Nazi, he started saying
[speaks fake German]
And Nazi's got those salutes, "Hi, Hitler!"
[pokes out arm and waves fingers]
Oooo... Its the Big One... You hear that Elizabeth... I'm comin' to you, I'm comin' home to Georgia
I'm 65. People say I look 55. I feel 45. I'd settle for 35 and you make me feel 25.
Do you read Ebony magazine?
No.
Why not? I read Life.
Everything is just gravy.
Groovy.
Groovy.
When we're finished, people will be able to walk down the streets safely in Los Angeles.
Yeah they can walk in Los Angeles, but they'll still be running in Watts.
Hub Cap.
Garbage Can.
Coming up next is a new show about today's teenagers entitled, "All in the Family Way".
What?
Watch it, sucka.
Say Fred, that's one of them Superman suits ain't it?
Superfly Bubba, Superfly.
[Bubba pretends to be Blind Mellow Jelly's son]
I want my daddy's records.
[Esther sees Fred with a lollipop]
You just suck on that sucker, sucka.

[about his cologne]
It's called "A Day in Paris".
Smells more like "A Night in El Segundo".

[on the phone with his employer]
What do you mean what am I doing home? I already worked an hour and a half overtime for you. Did you expect me to unload all those bath tubs by myself? I don't get that. Of course I want the j... But I... WHAT? Well you're a *white* one!
[hangs up]
How do you spell that, Honkey?
Uh Y T!
Y T?
Yeah! Say it again!
Y T Y T...
Whitey!
Will a Juan Diego Perez please rise?

[whispering to Lamont]
He's a Mexican.
Yeah, no kidding.

[a Mexican man takes the stand]
I'll bet he got a speeding ticket. See, when Mexicans finally get their cars started, they gotta get where they're going real fast before their car stalls again.
buncha jive niggers.
Pop!

[singing]
I'm Popeye the Sailor Man/I'm Popeye the Sailor Man/I like to go swimmin'/With bowlegged women/I'm Popeye the Sailor Man.
I told you, I don't want no dentist to be fooling around in my mouth.
Why not?
Because they make me nervous. All them drills and chisels and screw drivers they be sticking down your mouth. They don't even care if they hurt you or not, they just yank you and thank you.
where do these dentists come from?
Canada, Mexico...
Africa?
[Dr. Rogers, an African American dentist whom Fred had earlier shunned, enters]
Hello, brother.
Now, Mr. Sanford, if you'll open your mouth nice and wide, so I can get your foot out first!
Hi Grady!
Outta my way Lamont.
[to Fred]
You expect me to beleive a cock and bull story like that?

[on the phone; In Japanese accent]
I calling to tell you that we are not going to buy any property in your brock for the brewery and it's not Fled's "flault". No, it's not Fled's "flault"... Fled. Fled! FRED, you big, dumb Puerto Rican!
[hangs up]
Did you get the liquor Rollo?
No, I can't right now.
Why not?
The store's still open!
We're not going to have this baby like you had Lamont.
You gonna to have this baby on purpose?
[repeated line]
Fish-eyed fool!

[Lamont is recovering from over-drinking]
You were so drunk last night, you hung your clothes up in the closet!
I always hang my clothes up in the closet.
Yeah, but usually you take 'em off!

[Fred Sanford has attended the taping of a cooking show in a final desperate attempt to sell his Whopper Choppers. He is taking his seat in the audience when he apparently goes past an ugly fat woman in an improper manner]
[annoyingly]
Would you please?
Not if you were the last woman on earth.
Oh, hi... um... uh... who are you?
Esther, fool.
Hi, Estherfool.
[Julio has been robbed overnight, and Fred saw the robbers but is refusing to cooperate]
Mr. Sanford, by turning these men in, you give them the opportunity to be rehabilitated.
Yeah, but that'll give them the opportunity to have me decapitated!

[Repeated lines between the two]
Oh nope. Nope! Nope! Nope!
What do you mean "Nope Nope Nope"?
I ain't afraid to give you one across the lips.

[to Fred]
How could you do this Fred? I remember the day you married my sister.
That's the way it used to be, Pop, now adays they give you one of them needles and you don't even know what hit you.
Oh, now I know I ain't going.
Why not?
Are you kidding? A needle. I don't wanna get hooked on that stuff. It'd change me from Friendly Fred to Junkie Joe.
You just dumb, son. You just dumb.
My name's Fred Sanford. That's S-A-N-F-O-R-D period.
When a person has three heart attacks, he's dead. You had fifteen.
[Referring to Donna and Esther, respectively]
Beauty and the Beast.
[repeated line]
You big dummy.

[Fred has put up Lamont's room for rent while he's in Mexico. A pregnant woman knocks on his door to request the room]
Hello!

[looks at her stomach]
Hello to both of you.
[Lamont bought 2 coffins at an auction and is trying to convince Fred of their worth]
C'mon pop, we're gonna make a killin' on these.
Well then why don't you make two killin's and get them outta here.
This house was always damp, even my bed was damp.
Now you can't go blaming that on me.
I'm sure everything is cold.
Cool.
Cool.
Relax, he's cool.
The report does not confirm body temperature.
You gotta always wash your hands before you eat, and from the looks of you, you must have the cleanest hands in town.
Some people just shake'n bake, but I buy'n fry.
Don't cut your leg on any rusty metal. Know what happens when you cut your leg on rusty metal?
No.
You get lock-jaw, then you can't eat no fat burgers.
[Fred is showing Lamont a photo album]
Lamont, this is you as a baby... you had to be the ugliest baby alive.
If you wanna make a show about my life, why not make it black? With black people, and call it 'Sanford and Son'?
'Sanford and Son'? It would never make it.
This is a real Chinese restaurant, isn't it?
No, it's a pizza parlor. Of course it's a Chinese restaurant.
I can't eat here. I can't eat that Chink food.
Looks like you guys have been torn off.
Ripped.
*Ripped* off.
You remember that command they used to give? "Don't fire 'till you see the whites?"
It was, "Don't fire 'till you see the whites of their eyes".
Bufford never waited that long.

[sees Esther in the Sanford Arms]
No animals allowed in here.
Why you...

[to Esther]
Let me handle this.

[to Fred]
Watch it, sucka!

[to white bank teller]
I'd like to make a deposit.
OK. How much?

[shakes fist]
How bout five in your mouth?
We better get down to the Nifty Grifty.
Nitty Gritty!
Nitty Gritty.

[about Esther]
This is our plumber but you can see that the pipes have backed up into her face.
That's what they do. Them welfare people look under your bed, down your throat and up your mattress. And while they're prowling, your stomach's growling.
for people in financial trouble. What do you think we pay taxes for? We'd just be taking advantage of something that was setup for people like us.
What do you mean 'people like us'?
Poor people. The have nots.

The have nots? Well if the have nots could get something from the haves and the haves gave the have nots half of what they have, then the haves would still be the haves but the have nots would be the have somethings.
We may have to go all the way to the highest court in the land.
All the way.
And you're willing 100%?

All the way. See, this is America, where a right makes might, where justice is blind, where law is king, where a man should be able to persue his democratic right no matter what it costs him in time, effort and/or money.
Okay, I'll need about $10 to file the complaint.
I'll drop the case.
You fish-eyed heathen.
You must be Poppa Sanford.
No, I'm Mama Cass.
The reception in the squad car was terrible. We couldn't pick up anything but police calls.
Grady, you're gonna be the first person in history to get busted for molesting a vegetable.
The first signs of marijuana use are the hungries, or munchies.
Weren't they in The Wizard of Oz?
That's Munchkins.

[has discovered Fred cheats on his taxes]
Why only put $200? Why not $1,000? Or $2,000? $10,000? Why not even a million?
That's good. Put that down, Calvin.
Pop, if you put that, you go to jail.
Take that off, Calvin.
How's your voice?
I'm a little hoarse.

[points to his horse]
So is he. Ha ha ha.

[in court]
Look at the judge. He's a brother. We lucked out.

[a black dentist has exited and a white dentist enters]
You see the difference between them right away?
Yeah, it's like night and day.
Nope that's not Elizabeth. Too young, Too white.
Ow my heart. I think I'm having a heart attack. You hear that Elizabeth I'm coming to join you honey. Your dummy son has made me a wooden overcoat. Oh, Elizabeth.
Whats the matter with you?
Shut up, foo!

[Smitty's partner reads Miranda rights to a man accused by Grady of stealing a radio, but the man shows a purchase receipt to Smitty]
Hopkins?
Yeah?
Remain silent!
Well, we better divide.
That's SPLIT!
We better SPIT!
THAT'S SPLIT!
Ester what are you doing here?
What do you mean what am I doing here?
Well Wolfwoman don't come out till there's a full moon.
My my poor couch. I bet you never been sat on by a buffalo!
I ain't givin you nothing you stubborn bull headed old buzzard.
Who you calling old?
Now Fred
Yes Sir?
Your neice is in town.
What neice?
WHAT NEICE? YOU'R ONLY NEICE and she is here to go to college.

[Fred tells Lamont about his $500 giveaway idea]
This idea is going to put us on easy street...
Is that where the poor house is located?
What is fried Won Ton?
Chinese kreplah.
Oh I ain't gonna eat that. That stuff'll kill you.
Hey Pop, I got a date tonight. I'm already late now.
You can't do that. Listen, I made some arrangements. I got a surprise for you.
Uh-huh. Is it another relative coming? How much does this one weigh?
Take out the trash Rollo.
Where is it Mr. Sanford?
It's in your shoes!

[to Ah Chew and Esther]
My two favorite diseases in the same room. Yellow Jaundice and the Black Plague.

[sees Esther]
There's got to be some mistake. This is not my Lena, this is someone's hyena.

[calling the newspaper]
Hello? Is this the Herald Examiner? Well, lemme speak to Harold.
A pool table like this in a store would cost you two hundred bucks.
Well how much do you want for it?
Two hundred bucks.
I thought that's what you said it would cost in a store.
Well, wha'choo think I'm runnin' here? A taco stand?

[phoning their neighbor, afraid they've accidently shot him]
You know, pop, the phone company says to always let the phone ring at least 10 times, because sometimes people be taking a shower or something.
Yeah... and sometimes, they be dead!
Look at this, Pop. Monday morning - bingo. Tuesday evening - Doctor Talbot's lecture on the cause and cure of constipation.
Wednesday morning - bingo!
I brought you somethin' too, Esther.
Why, that's nothing but a clear piece of plastic.
No, it ain't. Put it up to your face. That's your Hallowe'en mask.
Would you like a drink, Aunt Esther?
No, she wouldn't like a drink.
Why wouldn't I like a drink?
Because you *are* a drink... a Zombie.
Pop, if we don'y pay our bills the bank is gonna kick us out of our house

[Esther walks in]
Speaking of outhouses...
Fred, I need your help.
But, Esther, I'm a junkman, not a plastic surgeon.
But, Fred, I need your truck.
I agree. Son, take the truck and run over Esther's face.

[Hoppy and Jones are taking the TV set that was Grady's to the TV repair man that was robbed]
We gotta crack.
Split!
Split.
Grady, why are you my friend?
I don't know
I don't know either.

[after Jones and Hoppy have left with the TV set]
I hope you're happy, Grady. I'm out of $50 bucks.

[shouts]
You should not have sold my set!
You're wrong, Grady. That was *my* set.
[there's a knock at the door]
[to Lamont]
It's the door.

[sarcastically]
No kidding.
Well?
Well, what?
You want me to answer it?
No, have it framed and hang it on the wall.
[Fred is getting a chest X-ray]
Lean your shoulders against the wall. That's right.
[slaps him on the rear]
Tuck it in!
I'll tuck it in if you tuck yours in!

[Referring to Esther]
Excuse the mess. She was just leaving.
[Fred has fallen asleep while writing out his will. Lamont goes beside of Fred, which wakes him]
And the tall dummy I see before me, I leave to the San Francisco Zoo!
